newsitem.title: UK: Ford sees 1,000 job losses in mainland Europe.
newsitem.headline: Ford sees 1,000 job losses in mainland Europe.

text.p: U.S. car giant Ford, which on Wednesday announced plans to eliminate 4,000 jobs through early retirement, on Thursday indicated that around a quarter of the cuts would be in continental Europe.
Ford's global news manager Don Hume, based in Britain, told Reuters that the 1,000 mainland Europe job cuts were likely to be focused in Germany and Spain.
He added that the British operation had already announced that 1,000 jobs would go a few weeks ago and that was also part of the total.
Ford chairman Alex Trotman has been visiting the Valencia plant and will visit Germany next, bypassing Britain.
